{"step_by_step_thinking": "Anganwadi centers are a type of rural child care center in India. They are responsible for providing basic health care in Indian villages. It is a part of the Indian public health care system. Basic health care activities include contraceptive counseling and supply, nutrition education and supplementation, as well as pre-school activities. The growth monitoring in children at these centers is usually done by measuring the weight for age, which is a simple and effective method to monitor the growth of a child.
